thread.title: Crowds ring in the new year in Saratoga Springs, offering advice for 2026 - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Crowds ring in the new year in Saratoga Springs, offering advice for 2026 - NewsBreak

author: Payton Cavanaugh
title: Crowds ring in the new year in Saratoga Springs, offering advice for 2026 - NewsBreak
text:
By Payton Cavanaugh ,
1 hours ago
SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y. ( NEWS10 )– Business was booming this New Year’s Eve night in Saratoga Springs. People crowded the streets, and local businesses, to ring in the new year.
“It’s one of our busiest nights of the year,” said Nick Crisorio, an employee at Saratoga City Tavern. “We see a lot of influx of people in and out and it’s just a great time. Everyone wants to celebrate the New Year the right way.”
Get the latest news, weather, sports and entertainment delivered right to your inbox! From stopping in for a drink, to shopping for the best sparkles and sequins for the night, business all over the Spa City were busy this afternoon.
“We’re getting a lot more people in looking for outfits and gifts,” said Gilded Boutique employee Ava Beach. “Sparkly dresses, that kind of stuff, holiday attire.”
People filled the city celebrating all the best moments of 2025, and looking forward to what’s to come in 2026. As we prepare for the year ahead, here’s a few lessons they’re carrying into this new season:
Download our WTEN+ streaming app on Roku, Fire TV and Apple TV! “The importance of caring for people and trying to make a change in our world,” said Judy Galvin.” “To be patient and to give grace for other people and yourself, when times get tough,” noted Kate Passaro. “Be grateful for what we have,” added Tori Marcy. “If you are determined anything is possible,” stated Andrew Marcy.” “The greatest illusion is that life is perfect,” explained Sophia, a local kid. “Asking for help isn’t giving up. It’s refusing to give up.” It was an eventful evening in Saratoga Springs, and NEWS10’s Payton Cavanaugh said she learned a lot from the people she spoke with. For everyone celebrating, have a safe and happy new year in 2026!
